column4: hello!  could someone please remind me where to look for    httpd?  i forget   =(
/etc/apache2 ?
nope, but thank you fro trying!
I didn't understand what you asked to be honest. What do you mean you can't find it?
sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 start :)
thanks a ton! that's what i was looking for =D
apache IS httpd
hmm...  i'm not sure what to make of this then:  * Forcing reload of apache 2.0 web server... apache2: Could not determine the server's fully qualified domain name, using 127.0.0.1 for ServerName
nothing, its normal if you don't have a proper DNS setup.
i'm talking about the part where it says httpd is not running, and it just hangs..
means, that apache can't lookup your fqdn, so its using 127.0.0.1 as its server name.
type sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart
then, point your browser to http://127.0.0.1/
, that's what I did to get the message you saw..  when i type it the command hangs up and says httpd is not running
just do what I said please, and tell me what you see in your browser.
: i did it and got this: * Forcing reload of apache 2.0 web server... apache2: Could not determine the server's fully qualified domain name, using 127.0.0.1 for ServerName
yes, I know what you got on the console, just browse to http://127.0.0.1/
the server is still running but it's not reloaded the modules..      thanks for your help though =D  i think i need to go to maybe the mono channel hehe
you are using mono?!
: yup =D     , i'm trying to at least
you should have said that from the beginning. The information you see on the console, is not an error messages, just informative.
